question: Q595
question_text: Can we derive the number of generations (3) from dim(SU(2)) = N_c?

main_result.algebraic_origin: J_3(O) is 3x3 Hermitian matrices over octonions
main_result.key_insight: The 3x3 matrix structure forces all these to equal 3

supporting_arguments.su3_fundamental: Fundamental rep of SU(3) has dim 3
supporting_arguments.fano_plane: 3 points per line in octonion multiplication

Q598.question: Can generation mass ratios be derived from J_3(O)?

Q599.question: Does each generation occupy a distinct Peirce subspace?

Q600.question: Why is the third generation so much heavier?

conclusion.key_result: N_generations = 3 is algebraically forced by J_3(O) being 3x3
conclusion.significance: One of the deepest mysteries in physics RESOLVED
conclusion.broader_impact: No fourth generation can exist - algebraically forbidden
